page.title: 07Hawford Lodge Prep. School
page.content: An independent preparatory boys' school foudned in 1955 by J D Garrad, MA with 15 boys in an old house dating from 1735. The house and 6 acres were purchased for Â£6000 from Capt. Ames. The site now covers 30 acres, 15 of which are let for grazing in the summer. At present 168 boys aged 7 to 13 years. In September 1985 boys and girls aged 5 to 7 will be admitted. There are 11 classrooms and 5 specialist rooms. There are 12 full -time teachers plus Head. Each class has between 16 and 20 pupils. Subjects taught include English, Maths, French, Latin, Greek, Science, History, Geography, RE and Art. Pupils are prepared for Common Entrance examination. Main games are football, rugby, cricket and athletics.
